page.title: 02Birdlife,Cockerham Saltmarsh
page.content: Huge numbers of gulls and terns visit this area for feeding and roosting. Gulls are present throughout the year,but terns only in Spring and Summer.The sandflats provide a rich source of food and most waders spread out at low water on the inter -tidal area to feed.At low tide they use the sandflats as a huge roosting ground. The commonest wader, Oystercatchers, reach peak numbers in October. Other commonly observed waders in mid-winter are the Redshanks,Curlew, Lapwing,Dunlin,Godwit and Turnston. Mallard together with Shelduck breed in this area ,and large numbers of Teal, Widgeon,Pintail and Shoveler are abundant, especially in Winter. Another visitor, the pink-footed goose,feeds inland but goes on to the sandbanks to roost. Cormorant,Heron & various raptors also visit.
